text: this is the procession that brings the

this will make its way into the

which was built originally in 1865 so

see the regalia being transferred now at

it to be taken into the regalia room at

an interesting feature here is that the
state ceremonies feature the Queen's

the role of the footman there they are
and they are a reminder that in days
gone by the crown jewels will be brought
down to Westminster by River because
that was a rather safer route and coming
down from Westminster by Road
we have several new faces in the

Michael Vernon Lieutenant Colonel
Michael Vernon with a long distinguished

over from Andrew Ford so he's waiting
there just at the foot of the stairs and
the crown jeweler will bring out the
Imperial state crown with its 3,000
gemstones only seen at coronations and
at state openings of parliament so it's
a rare sight michael vernon in his first
state opening ready to take the crown
into the regalia room where it'll be
placed on a different kind of cushion to
be taken up to the Royal gallery to be
put on display there until the Queen's
arrival
I mentioned too that that is just one of
